titles.title: A bill to amend the Victims of Crime Act of 1984 to require State compensation for State residents who are victims of crimes occurring outside the State if the crimes would be compensable crimes had they occurred inside that State.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Criminal Justice.

bill.summary: 6/25/1987--Introduced. Amends the Victims of Crime Act of 1984 to require State crime victim compensation programs receiving Federal assistance to compensate State residents who are victims of crimes occurring outside the State if the crimes would be compensable had they occurred inside the State.
